snippet: “The Kidnappers Foil,” by a traveling filmmaker of the early 20th century, exists in many versions made in many different towns. And more versions are likely out there to be discovered.
abstract: Archivist and teacher Caroline Frick is on hunt for multiple versions of The Kidnappers Foil, short made by traveling filmmaker Melton Barker in the early 20th century; is seeking to preserve copies of film because its young actors offer rare look at regional accents at that time.
lead_paragraph: “The Kidnappers Foil,” by a traveling filmmaker of the early 20th century, exists in many versions made in many different towns. And more versions are likely out there to be discovered.

headline.seo: ‘The Kidnappers Foil,’ a Local-Talent National Treasure
headline.main: The Legacy of a Camera-Toting Huckster
headline.print_headline: The Legacy of a Camera-Toting Huckster
